Bag II

pq



questions.latexText: \(Given three indentical bags each containing 10 balls, whose colours are as follows : 3^{2} 5^{4} 3^{3} 5^{1}^{4}Red Blue Green Bag I Bag II Bag III A person chooses a bag at random and takes out a ball. If the ball is Red, the probability that it is from bag I is p and if the balls is Green, the probability that it is from bag III is q, then the value of \frac{11}{pq}    is : (1) 6 (2) 9 (3) 7 (4) 8\)
